AlertDetailOverrideAlertDisplayNameForma: Trying to Sign-in using Suspicious User Agents
Description:
A User-Agent string is a line of text that a browser or application sends to a web server to identify itself. It typically includes the name and version of the browser/application, the operating system, and the language

Threat actors frequently alter or fabricate User-Agent strings, sometimes aiming to camouflage their traffic within legitimate web requests.
DisplayName: [sameer] Trying to Sign-in using Suspicious User Agents
Name: cc9ad577-faba-483d-8491-b9a5024f9ae1
Query:
SigninLogs
| where UserAgent contains "http_user_agent"
   or UserAgent contains "nanodep-godep/0"
   or UserAgent contains "kmdjdheyytgebfghehhenegsdfsdf"
   or UserAgent contains "User-Agent:Mozilla/"
   or UserAgent contains "Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE 10.0; Windows NT 10.0; WOW64; Trident/7.0; Specula; Microsoft Outlook"

   or UserAgent contains "Windows Explorer"
